Ingredients.1: 1 (3 ounce) package lime flavored Jell-O® mix

Ingredients.2: 1 (3 ounce) package orange flavored Jell-O® mix

Directions.1: Place lime, orange, and strawberry gelatin mixes into 3 separate 9x9-inch glass dishes.

Directions.2: Pour 1 cup boiling water into each flavor of gelatin mix; stir the gelatin until dissolved.

Directions.3: Pour 1 cup cold water into each flavor of gelatin, stir to combine, and refrigerate the 3 flavors of gelatin until set, at least 4 hours.

Directions.4: Heat pineapple juice in a saucepan until hot but not simmering. Stir unflavored gelatin into pineapple juice until dissolved. Refrigerate pineapple juice mixture until cool and thickened, about 30 minutes. Stir occasionally.

Directions.5: Mix graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and brown sugar together in a bowl. Set 1 cup of crumb mixture aside for garnish. Press remaining 2 cups crumb mixture into the bottom of a 9x13-inch cake pan to make a crust.

Directions.6: Pour cream into a large metal mixing bowl and beat with an electric mixer until the cream is fluffy and forms soft peaks, about 3 minutes. Slowly beat sugar into whipped cream, 1 or 2 tablespoons at a time; beat in vanilla extract.

Directions.7: Cut the different flavors of gelatin into cubes. Use a thin spatula to lift the cubes away from the bottom of the dish and loosen them.

Directions.8: Very gently fold the thickened pineapple juice and gelatin cubes into the whipped cream mixture until thoroughly combined. Spoon into the graham cracker crust.

Directions.9: Sprinkle the cake with reserved graham cracker crumb mixture.

Directions.10: Refrigerate until set, at least 3 hours to overnight.
